location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, transmits two letters (not included) from Mr Fraser to Francis Warden, plus a further two letters (also not included) from Fraser to the Governor in Council, Mountstuart Elphinstone. Dow reports that Mirza Hussun is returning from Ispahan [Eşfahān] in charge of the horses and mules which belonged to the establishment of the late Doctor Andrew Jukes. Dow goes on to describe the horses and mules and speculates on whether they could be sold either in Bushire or in India.
